metadata.title: CVE-2021-1095 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Windows and Linux contains a vulnerability inthe kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys) handlers for all control calls withembedded parameters where dereferencing an untrusted pointer may lead todenial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-1095` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcuda1-384 - 390.144-0ubuntu1
libnvidia-cfg1-390 - 390.144-0ubuntu1
libnvidia-common-390 - 390.144-0ubuntu1
libnvidia-compute-390 - 390.144-0ubuntu1
libnvidia-decode-390 - 390.144-0ubuntu1

libnvidia-fbc1-390 - 390.144-0ubuntu1

xserver-xorg-video-nvidia-390 - 390.144-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nvidia-graphics-drivers-390 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '390.144-0ubuntu1').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-418-server package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '418.211.00-0ubuntu1').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-430: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
nvidia-graphics-drivers-440: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
nvidia-graphics-drivers-450-server package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '450.142.00-0ubuntu1').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-455: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
nvidia-graphics-drivers-460 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '460.91.03-0ubuntu1').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-470 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '470.103.01-0ubuntu2').
